media:group.media:title: Climate Change: Capitalism's Final Boss
media:group.media:description:

UK PEOPLE: 
Pop your postcode in on this page and they will give you your MP's email, address & phone number: https://members.parliament.uk/members/Commons
Also, do research on your MP and consider the best way of getting through to them (tips and an example email here): https://www.campaigncc.org/lobbying_mps

Join Extinction Rebellion: https://extinctionrebellion.uk/

UK & USA: Consider asking them to push to join this: https://beyondoilandgasalliance.com/

Here's my linkies:
Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/munecat
Merch store: https://teespring.com/en-GB/stores/munecat-store
Instagram https://www.instagram.com/munecatmusic
Twitter https://www.twitter.com/munecatmusic

Hello again, today we are looking at the huge amounts of copium taken every day by conservatives in the UK & the US as they talk about climate change. This includes denying it exists, denying it is caused by humans, and denying government regulation will fix anything.

We will be tearing apart a terrible Ben Shapiro take, looking at the UK's Tory pundits and analysing the way Extinction Rebellion and Insulate Britain have been approaching the issue by blocking streets in protest and generally holding street parties that look like Burning Man. 

I'll also be critising the way the media has been participating in false balance by platforming denial, and pushing the blame onto the consumer with 'carbon footprint' propaganda, all of it funded by right-wing libertarian think-tanks, and the Koch Brothers among other oil barons, of course.

And then, we shall be asking, well, how do we fix this? Is there a solution? Has neoliberalism doomed us all, or is there hope? Does Jeffrey Bezos have the answer?

Sources: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1W_VdKfHiIl0W94yrzYUj1Q_23RycfSFjaeL8ywGBG5E/edit?usp=sharing
